channel.title: BBC News - Asia
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban accused of killing pregnant police officer
item.description: The killing comes amid increasing reports of escalating repression of women in Afghanistan.

item.title: Planes stranded at Mazar-i-Sharif airport waiting to leave
item.description: A US lawmaker accuses the Taliban of not letting several planes of Afghans and Americans leave.

item.title: India farmers' protests: Tens of thousands join rally in Uttar Pradesh
item.description: A vast crowd of protesters, some riding on tractors, rallied in Uttar Pradesh state.

item.title: Afghanistan: Former vice-president tells BBC he's in Panjshir Valley
item.description: Amrullah Saleh, in the Panjshir Valley, tells the BBC that fighters face a "difficult" situation.

item.title: New Zealand supermarket stabbing: Government to toughen anti-terror laws
item.description: The Auckland attacker has now been identified as Sri Lankan Ahamed Aathil Mohamed Samsudeen.

item.title: Afghanistan: What's life like since the Taliban took over?
item.description: People around the country tell the BBC they have lost basic freedoms and are struggling to survive.

item.title: New Zealand cinema worker left red-faced after voicemail blooper
item.description: A cinema employee in New Zealand went viral on TikTok with his attempt to leave a voicemail recording.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban says it will 'raise voice for Kashmir Muslims'
item.description: A spokesman for the group tells the BBC it plans to support Muslims in Indian-administered Kashmir.

item.title: North Korea: Kim Jong-un calls for urgent action on climate change
item.description: Typhoons last year badly impacted vital crops, as well as drought and heavy monsoon rains this year.

item.title: Yoshihide Suga to step down as Japan's prime minister
item.description: Mr Suga had been appointed to the role just a year ago following the resignation of Shinzo Abe.

item.title: Delhi air pollution: Study links poor air quality with obesity and asthma among children
item.description: The study advises urgent action to control air pollution in cities like Delhi.

item.title: Covid: Australia to get Pfizer doses from UK in vaccine swap
item.description: The UK will send four million Pfizer doses now to help Australia exit lockdowns, Canberra says.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: China's armless swimmer Zheng Tao dominates with four golds
item.description: The 30-year-old, who lost his arms from an electric shock, dominated the Games pool with four golds.

item.title: Why has Australia switched tack on Covid zero?
item.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

item.title: Beijing 2022: China readies for Winter Olympics as pressure grows
item.description: The upcoming Games are already proving controversial with calls for a boycott growing.

item.title: Life in Kabul under Taliban: Where is your male escort?
item.description: Lyse Doucet takes the temperature on the streets of the Afghan capital as the Taliban tighten their grip.

item.title: Afghanistan: What rise of Taliban means for Pakistan
item.description: Some Western powers hope that Pakistan could play a role as a mediator with the new Taliban government.

item.title: Panjshir - the valley trying to hold off the Taliban
item.description: The last bastion of resistance is still holding out just north-east of the capital, Kabul.

item.title: Syed Ali Shah Geelani: The man who fought for Kashmir’s freedom
item.description: Syed Ali Shah Geelani believed India should not rule the region and never changed his stand.

item.title: How North Korea’s founding father, Kim Il-sung, came to power
item.description: Professor Kim Hyung-suk had breakfast with the man who would rule North Korea for nearly 50 years

item.title: Shang-Chi: Why the MCU's first Asian superhero is empowering change
item.description: Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings sees Simu Liu front an Asian-led cast. Why does it matter?

item.title: China steps in to regulate brutal '996' work culture
item.description: Workers in China are fed up with the brutal 12-hour work days once seen as a key driver of success.

item.title: Beaten and humiliated by Hindu mobs for being a Muslim in India
item.description: Attacks on Muslims by Hindu mobs have risen in India, with little apparent official condemnation.
